basics.name: Albert (Sammy) Yee
basics.label: BA/MA Student
basics.summary: Hello! I am BA/MA Student studying at the Economics Department of the University of Hawaii at Manoa. My expected graduation is Spring 2025 with a combined Bachelors and Masters of Arts in Economics.

interests.name: Middle and High School Technology Enrichment

highlights: Mentored 20-30 first-year students at UH Manoa per Fall Semester
Facilitated credited writing intensive UNIV 110 course
Individually met with each of the 20-30 first-year students three times during the semester to ensure they were successful during their first semester at the university

work.company: University of Hawaiʻi at Mānoa and The Overwatch League
work.summary: Project Aloha Internship at Overwatch League in Partnership with UH Manoa
highlights: Assisted in set up, operating, and break down of the venue for Overwatch League’s 2022 Midseason Madness Tournament
Worked alongside OWL staff to create a player-friendly environment
Assisted in running promotion booths at various events
Completed routine maintenance and updated software for computers and other devices
Assisted teaching in Art and Game Design classes
Run weekly general meetings and officer meetings
Plan year, events, and operations for the MAG
Apply and and obtain sponsorships for MAG
Ensure deliverables and communicate with sponsors

volunteer.organization: Assets High School, Game Design Mentorship
volunteer.summary: Teaching assistant for Game Design Mentorship
highlights: Advanced knowledge in Swift and X-Code
Developed teaching skills for basic Swift concepts, and debugging code errors
Mastered basic game design concepts. Gained experience in Scratch, Swift, and X-Code
Chapter President, Pacific & Asian Affairs Council, Assets High School Chapter, 2019-2021

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.awarder: University of Hawaiʻi at Mānoa College of Social Sciences
awards.summary: The Dean's List recognizes students with a superior academic record, i.e., a minimum current grade point average of 3.5 for 12 or more credits of academic coursework

awards.title: Provost Achievement Scholarship
awards.summary: $10,000 per year for 4 years, and this scholarship is open to Hawai’i residents with a 3.7 cumulative high school GPA or higher to be considered.
